title: Calories in 1 Ounce Vodka
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 ounce vodka, including alcohol content, zero carbs, and nutrition basics for 80-proof spirits, plus tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard 80-proof (40% ABV) unflavored vodka; 1 fluid ounce (29.57 ml) serving; no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, and serving size; distilled spirits have no carbs or fats but calories from alcohol. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One ounce of 80-proof vodka has 64 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 ounce of vodka?
Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No, unflavored vodka has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars.
Proof level (ABV); higher proof means more calories per ounce.

faqs.q: Is vodka low-calorie compared to other alcohols?
faqs.a: Yes, similar to gin or rum; mixers add significant calories.

faqs.q: How many ounces in a standard shot of vodka?
faqs.a: Typically 1.5 ounces, which would be about 96 calories.
